content.description: obvious sit start down and left, heading right on lower holds to small cutter flake. Head up and around on jugs to top out far right

Another great looking boulder with dozens of variations.Lots of sit down starts to dynamic moves. Traverse route starts sitting further left at dihedral with right hand on jug. Do one or two move up then traverse right. Stay on higher jugs on down hill side. Keep traversing right around overhang to uphill side and continue as far as possible before top out.crux is on down hill side trying to keep your feet up.
content.location: north side 100yds above Kidney Bean. Another great looking boulder with dozens of variations. Sit start left or start further left on jugs. Traverse right. Stay on higher jugs on down hill side. Keep traversing right around overhang to uphill side and continue as far as possible before top out.

content.description: Start left with a sit start. Climb up and right  thru roof. Top out straight up on left side of headwall.
content.location: Stowaway Boulder

content.description: Start in the far right crack/cave and traverse the base to the left of the potato block, finsh at start of Santa's Line.
content.location: On the Potato block, see the map

content.description: Route has sit down start down and left under overhang. Climb right across jugs and traverse onto thin face. Grab triangle shaped hold with right and do big left hand move to side pull inside of arete. Continue up and right to top out. Move up middle thru pockets and sloper until right hand gets out to good arete hold. Then left hand in crack and right hand up arete. Pumpy and fun. Some variations don’t hold the grade. This climb is most classic and gets it’s grade by staying in the middle of the face. It is long, technical and pumpy. youtu.be/2pF_MfD_YDI
content.location: This is just behind the kidney bean.

content.description: It is a nice chunk of rock. There are 4 obvious lines here. This line being most proud so far. A more difficult squeeze line could be worthy here. Start this one on right part of roof. It goes a little right then left to headwall crimpers and tops out.
content.location: East side of south peak and almost to the top of it. If coming up hikers/biker trail look for approach starting in between two logs on uphill side of trail. The Stowaway boulder is straight up hill from here. Approach trail goes left from logs then zigzags up hill.

content.description: Overhanging rounded buttress which climbs thru a series of left hand slopers to better holds at the lip. Catch a rest before pulling the slab moves for the top out. Very exciting indeed. I had 3 pads and a spot.
content.location: East side of the north peak. Pull into first parking at Eagle then go straight up hill 150 feet. Catches sun mid morning and bakes till about 3 in the summer. Early or late in the day is best.

content.description: Climbs obvious line out roof. Long reach out to crimpers. Match then continue to jug. Top out mantle has crucial and small foot holds. Try the Screw Face sit start and climb low into the Shroomer. Its a fun link-up
content.location: west facing side of crag

content.description: climbing out of the little cave using both sides is the crux. Turning onto the slab is a little gropie. Mantle at the top is fun
content.location: south side near switch back

content.description: great Jug haul.
content.location: on the same boulder as shroomer. Its goes up easy jug line up and left then up

content.description: sit down start starting in corridor below the Shark Fin. Starts on cutter edges to obvious rail. Exit straight up thru roof onto slab.
content.location: shark fin zone

content.description: Traverse, start same as Scathed Beauty. Traverse right to left and continue to topout on face high block. There is a large cheatstone that drops the grade if you use it.
content.location: This boulder in on the East side of the main rock formation, when taking the main trail from the parking area to the saddle/ridge/summit you will exit the trail to the right just before the top, you'll see rocks about 100 ft from the trail. You'll know you're in the right spot when you see a scratched up wall with really low quality graffiti and names.

content.description: SDS with hands matched on triangle jug furtherest right, transverse left til next good triangle shaped jug, then move straight up through crimps to a delicate topout on slab.
content.location: This boulder in on the East side of the main rock formation, when taking the main trail from the parking area to the saddle/ridge/summit you will exit the trail to the right just before the top, you'll see rocks about 100 ft from the trail. You'll know you're in the right spot when you see a scratched up wall with really low quality graffiti and names.

content.description: Big flat looking face on north east side of saddle trail. This was done long ago but never put in. It was the first line on this boulder. I want to roll with the scath theme Eli had going. Great holds on vert face down low lead to slab top out. Maybe a little hi-ball.
content.location: It’s just off the main trail going thru the saddle on north east side. Walk thru manzanita from main trail on slight trail to base.

content.description: This line ascends the mouth of the chimney that houses the typical down climb for Mr. Potato Head, climb the simple chimney, straining to stay right at the mouth. Avoid using the wider more featured deep section for the V1 grade, if you use the ledge its V easy.
content.location: On the Potato block, see map

content.description: crux is holding the right hand pinch and finding the body position(drop left knee) to get diagonal jug with left. Its still a little heady from there to the ledge. Walk left on ledge to chimney and down climb.  youtu.be/nmk8H4h4law
content.location: on north side on ridge above cookie monster

content.description: Obvious line with great features. Starts on the slab. Then climb up left side of overhang following jugs up and right to top out.  Movement is great on perfect rock. Techniques are variable from slab to arete, overhanging jugs and a little power then the mental top out. youtu.be/SS0_NptX1l4
content.location: North butte west side upper buttress

content.description: Start the same as teardrop(in the cave, matched on left triangle) similar start moves get you out of the cave, move right, once your back is to the tree mantel the small block
content.location: Teardrop is directly uphill of kidney bean, see map.

content.description: Variation on Mr. Potato Head. Ignores the pinch block and moves left to follow small crimps up to the same finish jug as Potato Head.
content.location: very center of Potato block

content.description: start with right hand on triangle hold and left on good side pull on rib. Move up and right thru the sloping feature to the jug on the lower right side of slopers. One move to top from there. You can top out there or continue around the lip going left then down and around to back of boulder.
content.location: Kidney Bean Boulder is just up from parking area on north side

content.description: Great Great Boulder. Ive had entire sessions on just this one boulder. Best warm up starts with the jug line in the crack down and left and traversing up and right to top out center . Don't be turned off by the v0 warm up rating. This is a great work out boulder. There are countless cutters and edges suggesting hard variations to the top. Sit down starts are necessary lots of classic v4  moves on overhung rock; All connecting to top out.
content.location: NE side; If you walk up from north end of parking lot it is the first   boulder.

content.description: It’s a steep compression arete on perfect rock. Easy on the eye also. Only gets 2 stars because its so short and landing is steep and rocky. Really fun route tho
content.location: West side top of north hill 30 ft left of Mind Control

content.description: Extra short route packs a punch. Set up with the right heel hook and opposing side pulls. Compress on, move right hand up to sloper side pull and go for the top with either hand.
content.location: On east side just up hill from second parking spot.

content.description: This short overhanging blob with a couple fun good moves is not a classic. It starts in the corner and moves left thru overhanging jugs. Do a large move out left  to a perfect whole pad crimp, set up your feet and throw for the top. It’s great movement. Direct start option also. youtu.be/-AOeRXNbWbM
content.location: Park at 2nd campsite and walk 100 ‘ up hill. Its left of trail.

climbs.name: Hill Top Hermit Sit down start

content.description: crux is first move off side pulls to the jug then top out any route.Start sitting down and don't use the slab for your feet.    Pull on and throw left or right. Its a one move crux.
Start on the big hand rail. The crux is top out with hard to find  crimps; Sit down start makes it a lot harder. Lots of different easy tops outs make this a good warm-up boulder.
content.location: NE side; Next to Vampire

content.description: Once again lots of variations but most feel about V2. There are lines on both sides of arete and one on the arete. At least 6 different lines total.
content.location: on south side off the first switch back on hiking loop trail

content.description: Small boulder is less than 10 feet high.The original line on this boulder. Sit start down and right on obvious flake. Pull on and head left to top out on rounded arete feature across from grim reaper boulder.
content.location: Next to Grim Reaper.

content.description: killer rock quality with lots of variations all leading out left on head wall. Crux is holding the crimper on head wall. routes finish on big jug to top out. Some big loose stuff on very top but not a real issue. youtu.be/VVXQfrWZjMQ
content.location: Located just off eagle rock trail loop where it goes over the pass between the north and south ridges

content.description: Route is a continuation of the lower Vampire Traverse V6. The route starts left in the dihedral with left hand on a crimp and right hand on a bulge. Continue right across the center of the boulder on sloping hands to transition around the overhang and top out on the other side. Video of route here: youtube.com/watch?v=Wi3z0v7…
content.protection: a few crashpads and spotters to move them
content.location: Start in left dihedral of Vampire boulder and stay lower than holds for upper traverse. Continue around overhang and top out on other side.

content.description: Same start as freak show, follow a simple line of jugs straight up.
content.location: On freaky block, see map

content.description: Right of Santa's, Left of Mr. Potato. This line was established years ago by JC, never given a name/grade previously. JC let me know if you wanna rename this gem.
content.location: On the Potato block, see map

content.description: Start 5ft left of teardrop. Jam yourself as deep it the left crack as you can, start matched hands on a face high ledge. Traverse right, once you move around the bulge there is a slight downclimb, crux imo, continue moving right around the block, gets pumpy, finish is the same as lemon drop (mantel the small black once your back is to the tree). This is a fun and pumpy route! Hop on it and give me your opinions on the grade.
content.location: On teardrop block. See map.

content.description: goes up right side. V3 grade uses the sit down start to jug haul next to the tree. Crux is low. gets easier once you grab the juggy side pulls on flake up high. Good foot work with lots of foot switches keeps you moving.  youtu.be/Dr-6vZyFxKA
content.location: Cookie monster is at n.w. side of crag

content.description: This boulder is located right between grim reaper and shark fin. This traverse is maybe a bit contrived, but powerful and overhung in places. Sit start on the NW corner of the boulder, see photos for start. Traverse right around the boulder staying as low as possible. Avoid the small block wedged in by your feet or it cuts the grade to V0-V1. Continue right around the boulder as far as possible before top out.
content.protection: It's a boulder traverse. Use some pads if you want em.
content.location: Between Grim Reaper and Shark Fin. On the SW side of the area overall.

content.description: Start sitting down regardless of top out. Great climbing on this rock. Many variations all worth doing. A great warm up or warm down next to the Hot Head. This zone goes in the sun around 2 in the summer. Great in the summer mornings.
content.location: N.W. area and faces west

content.description: Same start as shark fin, instead of traversing left around a reachy corner this problem heads straight up, chimney through simple moves and mantel the top.
content.location: Shark fin area

content.description: Scenic and secluded towering just above forest tree tops. This place is beautiful. Lots of scattered rock. Not all good. But plenty of good chunks here and there with more first ascent potential. Mostly moderate to easy routes with lots of low balls.  youtube.com/user/jc42066
